XMLDB.COMMENT: XMLDB file for core Moodle tables

TABLE.NAME: config
TABLE.COMMENT: Moodle configuration variables

TABLE.NAME: config_plugins
TABLE.COMMENT: Moodle modules and plugins configuration variables

TABLE.NAME: course
TABLE.COMMENT: Central course table

FIELD.NAME: defaultrole
FIELD.COMMENT: The default role given to participants who self-enrol

TABLE.NAME: course_categories
TABLE.COMMENT: Course categories

KEY.NAME: parent
KEY.COMMENT: note that to make this recursive FK working someday, the parent field must be declared NULL

TABLE.NAME: course_display
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores info about how to display the course

TABLE.NAME: course_meta
TABLE.COMMENT: to store meta-courses relations

TABLE.NAME: course_modules
TABLE.COMMENT: course_modules table retrofitted from MySQL

TABLE.NAME: course_sections
TABLE.COMMENT: to define the sections for each course

TABLE.NAME: course_request
TABLE.COMMENT: course requests

TABLE.NAME: course_allowed_modules
TABLE.COMMENT: allowed modules foreach course

TABLE.NAME: event
TABLE.COMMENT: For everything with a time associated to it

TABLE.NAME: cache_filters
TABLE.COMMENT: For keeping information about cached data

TABLE.NAME: cache_text
TABLE.COMMENT: For storing temporary copies of processed texts

TABLE.NAME: grade_category
TABLE.COMMENT: to define categories to group activity grades

TABLE.NAME: grade_exceptions
TABLE.COMMENT: individual grades to be skipped for certain students

TABLE.NAME: grade_item
TABLE.COMMENT: items to be graded

TABLE.NAME: grade_letter
TABLE.COMMENT: to convert numerical grades to letter grades

TABLE.NAME: grade_preferences
TABLE.COMMENT: Preferences of the gradebook for each course

TABLE.NAME: log
TABLE.COMMENT: Every action is logged as far as possible

TABLE.NAME: log_display
TABLE.COMMENT: For a particular module/action, specifies a moodle table/field

TABLE.NAME: message
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores all unread messages

TABLE.NAME: message_read
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores all messages that have been read

TABLE.NAME: message_contacts
TABLE.COMMENT: Maintains lists of relationships between users

TABLE.NAME: modules
TABLE.COMMENT: modules available in the site

TABLE.NAME: scale
TABLE.COMMENT: Defines grading scales

TABLE.NAME: sessions2
TABLE.COMMENT: Optional database session storage in new format, not used by default

TABLE.NAME: adodb_logsql
TABLE.COMMENT: to save some logs from ADOdb

TABLE.NAME: timezone
TABLE.COMMENT: Rules for calculating local wall clock time for users

TABLE.NAME: user
TABLE.COMMENT: One record for each person

FIELD.NAME: imagealt
FIELD.COMMENT: alt tag for user uploaded image

FIELD.NAME: screenreader
FIELD.COMMENT: flag for determining whehter the user uses a screenreader.

TABLE.NAME: user_preferences
TABLE.COMMENT: Allows modules to store arbitrary user preferences

TABLE.NAME: user_lastaccess
TABLE.COMMENT: To keep track of course page access times, used in online participants block, and participants list

TABLE.NAME: stats_daily
TABLE.COMMENT: to accumulate daily stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

TABLE.NAME: stats_weekly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate weekly stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

TABLE.NAME: stats_monthly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate monthly stats

FIELD.NAME: roleid
FIELD.COMMENT: id of role for the aggregates

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_daily
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate daily stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_weekly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate weekly stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: stats_user_monthly
TABLE.COMMENT: To accumulate monthly stats per course/user

TABLE.NAME: post
TABLE.COMMENT: Generic post table to hold data blog entries etc in different modules

TABLE.NAME: tags
TABLE.COMMENT: tags structure for moodle

TABLE.NAME: blog_tag_instance
TABLE.COMMENT: tag instance for blogs

TABLE.NAME: role
TABLE.COMMENT: moodle roles

TABLE.NAME: context
TABLE.COMMENT: one of these must be set

TABLE.NAME: context_rel
TABLE.COMMENT: context relations, c2 is a parent (or higher) of c1

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

KEY.NAME: c2
KEY.COMMENT: Default comment for the key, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: capabilities
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines all capabilities

TABLE.NAME: role_allow_assign
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines what role can assign what role

TABLE.NAME: role_allow_override
TABLE.COMMENT: this defines what role can override what role

TABLE.NAME: role_assignments
TABLE.COMMENT: assigning roles to different context

TABLE.NAME: role_capabilities
TABLE.COMMENT: permission has to be signed, overriding a capability for a particular role in a particular context

TABLE.NAME: role_names
TABLE.COMMENT: role names in native strings

KEY.NAME: roleid
KEY.COMMENT: Default comment for the key, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: user_info_field
TABLE.COMMENT: Customisable user profile fields

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: datatype
FIELD.COMMENT: Type of data held in this field

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: user_info_category
TABLE.COMMENT: Customisable fields categories

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: user_info_data
TABLE.COMMENT: Data for the customisable user fields

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: mnet_enrol_course
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about courses on remote hosts

FIELD.NAME: remoteid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique ID of course on its home server

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_course table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_enrol_assignments
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about enrolments on courses on remote hosts

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique ID of user on *this* server

FIELD.NAME: courseid
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique ID of course on its home server

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_enrol_assignments table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_host
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about the local and remote hosts for RPC

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_host table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_host2service
TABLE.COMMENT: Information about the services for a given host

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_host2service table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_log
TABLE.COMMENT: Store session data from users migrating to other sites

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_log table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_rpc
TABLE.COMMENT: Functions or methods that we may publish or subscribe to

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_rpc table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_service
TABLE.COMMENT: A service is a group of functions

FIELD.NAME: offer
FIELD.COMMENT: Do we even offer this service?

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_service table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_service2rpc
TABLE.COMMENT: Group functions or methods under a service

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_service2rpc table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_session
TABLE.COMMENT: Store session data from users migrating to other sites

FIELD.NAME: confirm_timeout
FIELD.COMMENT: UNIX timestamp for expiry of session

FIELD.NAME: expires
FIELD.COMMENT: Expire time of session on peer

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_session table

TABLE.NAME: mnet_sso_access_control
TABLE.COMMENT: Users by host permitted (or not) to login from a remote provider

FIELD.NAME: accessctrl
FIELD.COMMENT: Whether or not this user/host can login

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the mnet_sso_access_control table

STATEMENT.NAME: insert log_display
STATEMENT.COMMENT: Initial insert of records on table log_display
